episode_summary: This episode covers a range of topics including the mystery of Charles Dickens' unfinished novel, the resurgence of pinball, Victorian reaction times, and the potential for humans to live on the moon.

facts.fact: In an attempt to work out who the murderer in Charles Dickens' last unfinished novel was, the lead character was put on trial.
In the past 10 years, the number of registered pinball players worldwide has gone from 500 to over 100,000.
The Victorians had better reaction times than we do today.
The first people to live on the moon might be cavemen.
